result.execSummary:
The defendant Petria M Milroy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Make False/Forged Prescription Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant shall complete all programming required by the Department of Corrections.

The defendant shall not obtain any written prescriptions; any prescriptions she obtains must be in electronic format, sent from the doctor directly to the pharmacist.

Burnett County cases 21TR249, 21TR250, 21TR251, 21TR252 were DRI.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Petria M Milroy

defendant.name: Milroy, Petria M
defendant.address: 28835 E Rooney Lake Dr, Spooner, WI 54801

records.addlTxt: 9:04 AM Cases 21CF86, 21TR249, 21TR250, 21TR251, 21TR252, and 22CF98 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Petria M Milroy appeared by video.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson appeared by video for Petria M Milroy. Cases are on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Anderson: def pleading in 21CF86 to Ct 2: poss THC; in 22CF98 to Ct 2: making false/forged prescription order; all other counts and cases will be DRI, joint rec for 1 year probation: Judge Mogen requires condition of probation to accept global resolution- no written prescriptions (must be e-prescriptions directly from doctor to pharmacy).  VR compliance assured by State.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews PLQ.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 of 21CF86 and 22CF98 and orders a JOC; remaining counts and cases are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, argues for 3 days jail credit- no objection from State.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  1 year probation, withheld: Conditions- court costs of $543 on THC count and $443 on prescription charge. The defendant shall complete all programming required by the Department of Corrections.  Def not to obtain any prescriptions in written form, must be electronic format only.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  3 days conditional jail w/ 3 days jail credit.  Appeal rights provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:06 PM Defendant, Petria M Milroy, appeared.  Atty. Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared on behalf of State of Wisconsin.  Def says she obtained Bruce Anderson as counsel, who cannot appear today, but did advise and prepare her for this hearing.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  Def pleads NG to misdemeanor.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  State does not request another bond.
